Description: A wide city street, often lined with trees and with a median.
A defined area within a city, especially one characterized by a particular characteristic or function.
An outlying district of a city, especially a residential one.
A broad road in a city, often lined with trees.
A very tall building of many stories, typically found in urban areas.
A paved public walk, typically one along the waterfront at a resort or in an urban park.
A covered passageway with arches along one or both sides, often lined with shops.
A departure and arrival building for passengers at an airport, seaport, or bus station.
A prominent or historically significant object or feature of a city.
The face of a building, especially the principal front that looks onto a street or open space.
An often large and luxurious indoor facility featuring a collection of shops, restaurants, and sometimes entertainment outlets.
A long, open, level area, typically beside the sea, along which people may walk for pleasure.
A building with many stories, typically found in densely populated urban areas, used for residential or office purposes.
A point at which two or more roads meet, typically featuring traffic signals or signs to manage the flow of vehicles and pedestrians.
A small, casual dining establishment known for serving simple meals in a modest setting.
A wide city street, typically lined with trees and designated for significant traffic flow.
A fortress, typically on high ground, protecting or dominating a city.
A place for the storage of large quantities of equipment, food, or some other commodity, often associated with transportation.
Relating to a city or town or its governing body.
A person walking in a city or other developed area, or relating to or designed for people walking.
A local bar or tavern where people gather to drink and socialize.
A small hotel or lodging that offers food and accommodations to travelers.
A platform where boats and ships are loaded, unloaded, or moored.
A narrow road or path, especially one between buildings in a city or town.
An upper room or floor in a building, typically in a commercial or industrial district, often converted into a living space.
An open public area in a city where people gather, often surrounded by shops and restaurants.
A densely populated, poorly maintained section of a city inhabited by people of low socioeconomic status.
A set of rooms forming an individual residence, typically on one floor and within a larger building.
A small retail establishment selling items to the public.
A car available for hire with a driver, used for transporting passengers.
A small dining venue offering coffee, tea, and light meals.
A public area with open space for recreation and relaxation.
A large indoor shopping complex with various stores and eateries.
A wide way leading from one place to another, especially one with a specially prepared surface which vehicles can use.
An establishment where alcoholic beverages are sold and consumed.
A point of entry or exit in a fence or wall, often leading to a building or enclosed area.
An open area enclosed by buildings, often used for a specific purpose like storage or a place for children to play.
A structure leading out from the shore into a body of water, used as a docking or loading place for ships.
A designated area within a city with a specific purpose, such as residential or commercial use.
A network of lines that cross each other to form a series of squares or rectangles, often used to describe city streets.
